## Situation 1

```{r NormCalc1Sit1, echo=FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide', message=FALSE}
library(NCStats)
( q1 <- distrib(0.11,mean=0,sd=1) )
( q2 <- distrib(-0.11,mean=0,sd=1,lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q3ab <- distrib(1.11,mean=0,sd=1) )
( q3a <- distrib(-1.45,mean=0,sd=1) )
q3ab-q3a

( q4 <- distrib(0.33,mean=0,sd=1,type="q") )
( q5 <- distrib(0.25,mean=0,sd=1,type="q",lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q6a <- distrib(0.05,mean=0,sd=1,type="q") )
( q6b <- distrib(0.95,mean=0,sd=1,type="q") )
```

1. The percentage of X<0.11 is `r formatC(100*q1,format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The percentage of X>-0.11 is `r formatC(100*q2,format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The percentage of -1.45<X<1.11 is `r formatC(100*(q3ab-q3a),format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The X that has 33% of Xs smaller is `r formatC(q4,format="f",digits=2)`.
1. The X that has 25$ of Xs larger is `r formatC(q5,format="f",digits=2)`.
1. The most common 90% of Xs are between `r formatC(q6a,format="f",digits=2)` and  is `r formatC(q6b,format="f",digits=2)`.

### R Appendix
```{r fig.show='hide', results='hide'}
<<NormCalc1Sit1>>
```

## Situation 2

```{r NormCalc1Sit2, echo=FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide', message=FALSE}
library(NCStats)
( q1 <- distrib(75,mean=70,sd=6,lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q2 <- distrib(63,mean=70,sd=6) )
( q3a <- distrib(62.3,mean=70,sd=6) )
( q3ab <- distrib(72.9,mean=70,sd=6) )
q3ab-q3a

( q4 <- distrib(0.3,mean=70,sd=6,type="q") )
( q5 <- distrib(0.5,mean=70,sd=6,type="q",lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q6a <- distrib(0.25,mean=70,sd=6,type="q") )
( q6b <- distrib(0.75,mean=70,sd=6,type="q") )
```

1. The percentage of Y>75 is `r formatC(100*q1,format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The percentage of Y<63 is `r formatC(100*q2,format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The percentage of 62.3<Y<72.9 is `r formatC(100*(q3ab-q3a),format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The Y that has 30% of Ys smaller is `r formatC(q4,format="f",digits=2)`.
1. The Y that has 40$ of Ys larger is `r formatC(q5,format="f",digits=2)`.
1. The most common 50% of Ys are between `r formatC(q6a,format="f",digits=2)` and  is `r formatC(q6b,format="f",digits=2)`.

```{r fig.show='hide', results='hide'}

```

## Black Bear Size

```{r NormBears, echo=FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
library(NCStats)
( q1a <- distrib(45,mean=60,sd=10) )
( q1ab <- distrib(65,mean=60,sd=10) )
q1ab-q1a
( q2 <- distrib(0.2,mean=20.9,sd=4.8,type="q",lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q3a <- distrib(0.25,mean=13.7,sd=1.9,type="q") )
( q3b <- distrib(0.75,mean=13.7,sd=1.9,type="q") )
```

1. Approximately `r formatC(100*(q1ab-q1a),format="f",digits=1)`% of the bears have a body length between 45" and 65".
1. The largest 20% of neck girths are greater than `r formatC(q2,format="f",digits=1)`".
1. The most common 50% of head lengths are between `r formatC(q3a,format="f",digits=2)` and `r formatC(q3b,format="f",digits=2)`.
1. This question cannot be answered because weight is not know to be normally distributed.

### R Appendix
```{r fig.show='hide', results='hide'}
<<NormBears>>
```

## Shrew Brain Weights

```{r NormShrew, echo=FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
( q1 <- distrib(0.09,mean=0.14,sd=0.04) )
( q2 <- distrib(0.17,mean=0.14,sd=0.04) )
q2-q1
( q3 <- distrib(0.3,mean=0.14,sd=0.04,type="q",lower.tail=FALSE) )
```

1. Approximately `r formatC(100*q1,format="f",digits=1)`% of short-tailed shrews have a brain weight of less than 0.09 g.
1. Approximately `r formatC(100*(q2-q1),format="f",digits=1)`% of short-tailed shrews have a brain weight between 0.09 and 0.17 g.
1. The largest 30% of short-tailed shrew brain weights are larger than `r formatC(q3,format="f",digits=2)` g.

### R Appendix
```{r fig.show='hide', results='hide'}
<<NormShrew>>
```

## Bus Arrival Times

```{r NormBART, echo=FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
( q1 <- distrib(5,mean=0,sd=3,lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q2 <- distrib(-4,mean=0,sd=3) )
( q3 <- distrib(4,mean=0,sd=3) )
q3-q2
( q4 <- distrib(0.25,mean=0,sd=3,type="q",lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q5a <- distrib(0.2,mean=0,sd=3,type="q") )
( q5b <- distrib(0.8,mean=0,sd=3,type="q") )
```

1. Approximately `r formatC(100*q1,format="f",digits=1)`% of arrivals are more than 5 minutes late.
1. Approximately `r formatC(100*q2,format="f",digits=1)`% of arrivals are more than 4 minutes early.
1. Approximately `r formatC(100*(q3-q2),format="f",digits=1)`% of arrivals are between 4 minutes early and 4 minutes late.
1. The latest 25% of arrival times are more than `r formatC(q4,format="f",digits=1)` minutes late.
1. The most common 60% of arrival times are between `r formatC(q5a,format="f",digits=1)` and `r formatC(q5b,format="f",digits=1)` minutes.
1. The arrival time is a continuous quantitative variable.


### R Appendix
```{r fig.show='hide', results='hide'}
<<NormBART>>
```

## Roe Deer Fawns

```{r NormRoeDeer, echo=FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
( q1 <- distrib(2,mean=2.235,sd=0.460) )
( q2 <- distrib(3,mean=2.235,sd=0.460,lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q3a <- distrib(1,mean=2.235,sd=0.460) )
( q3ab <- distrib(3,mean=2.235,sd=0.460) )
q3ab-q3a
( q4 <- distrib(0.076,mean=2.235,sd=0.460,type="q") )
( q5 <- distrib(0.042,mean=2.235,sd=0.460,type="q",lower.tail=FALSE) )
( q6a <- distrib(0.065,mean=2.235,sd=0.460,type="q") )
( q6b <- distrib(0.935,mean=2.235,sd=0.460,type="q") )
```

1. Approximately `r formatC(100*q1,format="f",digits=1)`% of does have less than two fawns.
1. Approximately `r formatC(100*q2,format="f",digits=1)`% of does have more than three fawns.
1. Approximately `r formatC(100*(q3ab-q3a),format="f",digits=1)`% of does have between one and three fawns.
1. The number of fawns such that 7.6% of does have fewer fawns is `r formatC(q4,format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The number of fawns such that 4.2% of does have more fawns is `r formatC(q5,format="f",digits=1)`.
1. The most common 87% of number of fawns per does are between `r formatC(q6a,format="f",digits=1)` and `r formatC(q6b,format="f",digits=1)`.

### R Appendix
```{r fig.show='hide', results='hide'}
<<NormRoeDeer>>
```

## Commercial Crayfishing

```{r NormCrayfish, echo=FALSE, results='hide', fig.show='hide'}
( q1ab <- distrib(110,mean=93,sd=8) )
( q1a <- distrib(90,mean=93,sd=8) )
50000*(q1ab-q1a)
50000*(1-q1ab)
```

1. I could send the Swedish market approximately `r formatC(50000*(q1ab-q1a),format="f",digits=0)` crayfish.
1. I could send the alternative market approximately `r formatC(50000*(1-q1ab),format="f",digits=0)` crayfish.

```{r fig.show='hide', results='hide'}
<<NormCrayfish>>
```
